titles.title: Providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 79) proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States authorizing the Congress and the States to prohibit the physical desecration of the flag of the United States.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-164, by Mr. Solomon.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 79 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. The motion to recommit may include instructions only if offered by the Minority Leader or his designee. If the motion to recommit includes instructions, the motion shall be debatable for one hour, equally divided.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 64.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 258 - 170 (Roll no. 428).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 271 - 152 (Roll no. 429).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/27/1995--Introduced. Sets forth the closed rule for the consideration of H.J. Res. 79 (prohibiting the physical desecration of the flag of the United States).
